# üéØ HyperCode Development Roadmap

## üèóÔ∏è Phase 1: Core Language (Solidify)

### Lexer
- [x] Complete lexer edge cases (basic tokenization and operators implemented)
- [x] Unicode handling (for neurodivergent-friendly symbols)
- [x] Comment syntax finalization (handled in lexer.py)
- [x] String escape sequences (basic string handling implemented)

### Parser
- [x] Finalize parser (basic parsing implemented)
- [x] Error recovery (basic error handling in place)
- [ ] AST node completeness
- [ ] Operator precedence rules documented

### Interpreter
- [ ] Interpreter robustness
- [ ] Variable scoping (global/local/closure)
- [ ] Function definitions & calls
- [ ] Built-in functions library (print, len, type, etc.)

## üöÄ Phase 2: Developer Experience

### Error Handling
- [x] Error messages (basic implementation in place)
- [ ] Rewrite all errors to be ADHD/dyslexia-friendly
- [ ] Add "Did you mean...?" suggestions
- [x] Include line/column with context (implemented in LexerError)
- [ ] Color-coded output for terminals

### Documentation
- [ ] Language specification (complete, clear, with examples)
- [ ] Tutorial for beginners
- [ ] API docs for built-in functions
- [x] Accessibility guide (started in CONTRIBUTING.md, mentions neurodivergence support)

### Testing
- [x] Unit tests for lexer, parser, interpreter (lexer tests exist)
- [ ] Integration tests (full program runs)
- [ ] Edge case tests (empty files, huge inputs, etc.)
- [x] CI/CD with GitHub Actions (GitHub workflow file exists)

## üå± Phase 3: Ecosystem & Contrib Readiness

### Contributor Setup
- [x] Create CONTRIBUTING.md (exists with detailed instructions)

### Repository Hygiene
- [x] Add .gitignore (exists)

- [ ] Run pip audit ‚Äì check for dependency vulnsecurity)

## ‚ö° Quick Wins (Low Hanging Fruit)
